njdot cnum slump flow test and visual stability index test a .
scope .
the slump flow is used to assess the horizontal free flow of selfconsolidating concrete scc in the absence of obstructions .
the test method is based on the test method for determining the slump aashto t num .
the diameter of the concrete circle is a measure for the flowability of the scc .
the visual stability index vsi is a visual evaluation of the segregation of the scc during the slump flow test .
b .
apparatus .
use the following apparatus num .
mold in the shape of a truncated cone with the internal dimensions numinch diameter at the base numinch diameter at the top and a height of num inches .
num .
base plate of a stiff nonabsorbing material at least numinches square marked with a circle marking the central location for the slump cone .
num .
handheld wood or metal float or trowel .
num .
wheelbarrow or other container to hold at least num cubic feet of scc .
num .
ruler or tape measure at least num inches long .
num .
a scoop or suitable container for filling specimen molds with scc .
experience has shown pails and plastic cylinder molds to be suitable containers .
c. procedure .
perform the following steps num .
sample the freshly mixed scc according to aashto t num .
num .
observe the scc in the wheelbarrow for segregation .
num .
moisten the base plate and inside of slump cone .
num .
place base plate on level stable ground .
place the inverted slump cone centrally on the base plate and hold down firmly .
num .
fill the cone with the scoop or other suitable container in num lift .
do not tamp rod or vibrate .
strike off the scc level with the cone with the trowel .
num .
remove any surplus scc from the base plate around the cone .
num .
raise the cone vertically and allow the scc to flow out freely .
num .
measure the final diameter of the scc in num perpendicular directions .
num .
calculate the average of the num measured diameters this is the slump flow in inches .
num .
rate the stability of the mixture in num increments by visual examination as specified in table cnum .
num table cnum visual stability index vsi rating criteria rating criteria num no evidence of segregation in slump flow patty or in the wheelbarrow .
num no mortar halo or aggregate pile in the slump flow patty but some slight bleed or air popping on the surface of the concrete in the wheelbarrow .
num a slight mortar halo num inch andor aggregate pile in the slump flow patty and highly noticeable bleeding in the wheelbarrow .
num clearly segregating by evidence of a large mortar halo num inch andor large aggregate pile in the center of the concrete patty and a thick layer or paste on the surface of the resting concrete in the wheelbarrow .
d. report .
report the following num .
identification number .
num .
location of concrete represented .
num .
date and time of testing .
num .
slump flow in inches .
num .
vsi rating .
num .
results of any other tests on the fresh concrete .

scope .
this test method is used for determining the static segregation resistance stability of scc using hardened test specimens .
this method provides a visual assessment of static segregation resistance of scc using a hardened visual stability index hvsi rating to evaluate molded or cored hardened concrete cylinders cut lengthwise in num .

apparatus .
use the following apparatus num .
num numinch cylinder molds for casting concrete test specimens shall conform to the requirements of aashto m num .
num .
handheld wood or metal float or trowel .
num .
a saw with a diamond or siliconcarbide cutting edge and capable of cutting specimens without excessive heating or shock .
num .
a suitable container for filling specimen molds with scc .
experience has shown pails and plastic cylinder molds to be suitable containers .
c. procedure .
perform the following steps num .
sample plastic scc according to aashto t num .
num .
mold two num numinch test specimens as near as practical to the place where they are to be stored .
if it is not practical to mold the specimens where they will be stored move them to the place of storage immediately after strike off .
place molds on a rigid surface free from vibration and other disturbances .
ensure that the supporting surface is level to within num inch per foot .
num .
fill the specimen molds in num lift poured using a suitable container without vibration rodding or tapping .
num .
strike off the surface of the concrete level with the top of the mold using a float or trowel .
num .
immediately after molding and finishing cap the specimens with a plastic cylinder lid or cover with a plastic bag .
store for a period up to num hours at a minimum temperature of num f. num .
before subjecting the specimens to sawing ensure that they have been cured for a minimum curing period of num hours or have attained a minimum compressive strength of num pounds per square inch according to aashto t num .
num .
saw specimens lengthwise down the center .
if a specimen can not be satisfactorily sawed smooth due to lack of curing then do not disturb the remaining specimens for an additional minimum curing period of num hours .
num .
make a visual assessment of the cut planes of the hardened concrete cylinder or core using the criteria in table cnum .
wet the cut planes to facilitate visual inspection .
num table cnum hvsi specimens rating criteria rating criteria num stable no mortar layer at the top of the cut plane and no variance in size and percent area of coarse aggregate distribution from top to bottom .
num stable no mortar layer at the top of the cut plane but slight variance in size and percent area of coarse aggregate distribution from top to bottom .
num unstable slight mortar layer less than num inch tall at the top of the cut plane and distinct variance in size and percent area of coarse aggregate distribution from top to bottom .
num unstable clearly segregated as evidenced by a mortar layer greater than num inch tall andor considerable variance in size and percent area of coarse aggregate distribution from top to bottom .
d. report .
report the following num .
identification number .
num .
location of concrete represented .
num .
date and time of molding .
num .
hvsi rating for each hardened specimen .
num .
results of any other tests on the fresh concrete .
njdot rnum operating inertial profiler systems for evaluating pavement profiles a .
scope .
this test method describes the procedure for operating and verifying the calibration of an astm e num class num inertial profiler system ips .
b .
apparatus .
use an ips that meets the requirements of aashto mp num and astm e num class num and the following num .
certify the ips according to aashto pp num at least every num years .
if a system component is replaced recertify the system .
perform the certification at a site approved by the department .
num .
the data system provides the raw profile data in an ascii format acceptable to the department .
num .
the computer program uses a highpass filter set at num feet and reads an ascii or text file for computing the international roughness index iri in inches per mile .
num .
the current version of roadruf proval or other department approved pavement profile analysis software is used to compute the iri .
c. procedure .
perform the following steps num .
operate the ips according to aashto pp num and astm e num .
num .
on a daily basis before data collection check the equipment and operating system for operational stability and calibration .
perform necessary calibration procedures according to equipment manufacturers procedures and applicable standards .
operators shall maintain a log documenting the calibration history .
num .
ensure that the operators of the ips have completed a profile training course such as nhi course num have been trained specifically on the ips they will be operating and are proficient in the operation of the ips .
num .
make provisions to automatically start and stop the ips recording at the beginning and end of testing .
place retroreflective traffic striping tape or other approved mechanism at the beginning and end of each direction of travel for automatically triggering the start and stop of profile measurements .
num .
collect at least nummile of data before the area to be tested to allow the system to stabilize before profile measurements are obtained .
collect data in a continuous run through the length to be tested .
if the run is interrupted discard the results and rerun the length .
num .
submit the raw data for determination of the iri .
num njdot snum rotationalcapacity test on long bolts in tension calibrator a .
scope .
this test method is used for determination of highstrength steel bolt assembly acceptance for rotational capacity using a tension calibrator .
use this test method for bolts long enough to fit in the tension calibrator .
use njdot snum for bolts that are too short to fit in the tension calibrator .
b .
apparatus .
use the following apparatus num .
calibrated bolt tension measuring device of size required for bolts to be tested such as skidmore wilhelm calibrator .
num .
calibrated torque wrench dial type .
num .
spacers andor washers with holesize no larger than num inch greater than bolt to be tested .
num .
steel section for mounting the bolt calibrator such as a flange of a girder or cross frame accessible from the ground .
c. procedure .
perform the following steps num .
to determine if the bolt is long enough for testing mark the first num to num full threads that are located closest to the bolt head .
insert the bolt into the tension calibrator and assemble a washer and nut onto the bolt up to the marked threads .
use a rotational capacity washer from the same rotational capacity lot as the bolt and nut .
if a washer is not required for the installation use an astm f num washer of the proper diameter for the test .
if the nut can not be fully threaded onto the bolt shank then the bolt is too short for testing and must be tested as specified in njdot snum .
if the nut is at least flush with the end of the bolt shank then continue testing .
num .
take apart the bolt assembly .
use shim plates or washers under the bolt head as needed to ensure that the num to num threads that were marked in step num are located within the grip of the device but are just visible from the opposite side .
reassemble the bolt washer and nut .
num .
tighten the nut using a hand wrench to the minimum snug tension as specified in table snum .
do not exceed the minimum snug tension by more than num kips .
table snum snug tension requirements bolt size num num num num num num num num num minimum snug tension kips num num num num num num num num num num .
match mark a corner of the nut and the face plate of the bolt calibrator .
num .
using the calibrated manual torque wrench tighten the bolt to the minimum tension listed in table snum num .
read and record the wrench torque required to reach the tension with the nut in motion .
read the actual bolt tension and record as the initial tension .
table snum initial tension requirements bolt size num num num num num num num num num minimum initial tension kips num num num num num num num num num num .
further tighten the bolt to the rotation listed in table snum .
measure rotation from the match mark in step num .
record the bolts final tension as indicated on the calibrator .
if an assembly fails by stripping or fracturing before reaching the rotation listed in table snum the assembly fails the test .
table snum required rotation rotation bolt length num degrees num turn num diameters num degrees num turn num diameters and num diameters num degrees num turns num diameters num .
the final bolt tension measured in step num must equal or exceed the value in table snum .
assemblies that do not meet this tension fail the test .
num table snum final tension requirements bolt size num num num num num num num num num minimum final tension kips num num num num num num num num num num .
loosen the assembly and remove nut to examine the threads on the nut and bolt .
check for signs of thread shear failure stripping or torsional failure of the nut and bolt .
assemblies that have evidence of thread shear stripping or torsional distress fail the test .
d. calculations .
calculate the maximum allowable torque in footpounds as follows maximum allowable torque num p d where p measured initial tension in pounds d bolt diameter in feet compare the torque as measured in step num to the maximum allowable torque .
if the measured torque is greater than the maximum allowable torque the assembly fails the test .
e. report .
report the following num .
size manufacturer and lot number for the bolt assembly .
num .
measured initial tension and torque .
num .
measured final tension and torque .
num .
observations of the thread condition .
num .
passfail status of the bolt assembly .
njdot snum rotationalcapacity test on bolts too short to fit tension calibrator a .
scope .
this test method is used for determination of highstrength steel bolt assembly acceptance for rotational capacity for bolt assemblies that are too short to fit in a tension calibrator .
use njdot snum for bolts that are long enough to fit in the tension calibrator .
b .
apparatus .
use the following apparatus num .
calibrated torque wrench and spud wrench or equivalent .
num .
spacers andor washers with holesize no larger than num inch greater than bolt to be tested .
num .
steel section with normal size hole to install bolt .
any available splice hole can be used with a plate thickness that will provide the number of threads under the nut required in step num of the procedure .
c. procedure .
perform the following steps num .
before testing verify that the bolt is too short for testing as specified in njdot snum .
num .
mark on the first num to num threads that are located closest to the bolt head .
num .
insert the bolt into the steel section using shim plates or washers under the bolt head as needed to ensure that the num to num threads that were marked in step num are just visible from the opposite side .
assemble a washer and nut onto the bolt up to the marked threads .
use a rotational capacity washer from the same rotationalcapacity lot as the bolt and nut .
if a washer is not required for the installation use an astm f num washer of the proper diameter for the test .
num .
snug the bolt using a hand wrench .
do not exceed num percent of the torque determined in step num .
num .
match mark a corner of the nut and the plate .
num .
using the torque wrench tighten the nut to the rotation listed in table snum .
use a second wrench to prevent rotation of the bolt head during tightening .
record the torque required to reach this rotation .
measure and record the torque required to reach the rotation with the nut in motion .
num table snum required initial rotation rotation bolt length num degrees num turn num diameters num degrees num turn num diameters and num diameters num degrees num turn num diameters num .
if the measured torque exceeds the values listed in table snum the assembly fails the test .
table snum maximum torque requirements bolt size num num num num num num num num num maximum torque ftlbs num num num num num num num num num num .
tighten the bolt further to the rotation required in table snum .
measure the rotation from the initial marking in step num .
assemblies that fail before this rotation either by stripping or fracture fail the test .
table snum final initial rotation rotation bolt length num degrees num turn num diameters num degrees num turn num diameters and num diameters num degrees num turns num diameters num .
loosen the assembly and remove nut to examine the threads on the nut and bolt .
check for signs of thread shear failure stripping or torsional failure of the nut and bolt .
assemblies that have evidence of thread shear failure stripping or torsional failure fail the test .
d. report .
report the following num .
size manufacturer and lot number for the bolt assembly .
num .
measured torque at the initial rotation .
num .
observations of the thread condition .
num .
passfail status of the bolt assembly .
njdot snum verifying direct tension indicators dti a .
scope .
use this test method to verify and install highstrength steel bolts using direct tension indicators dtis .
b .
apparatus .
use the following apparatus num .
calibrated bolt tension measuring device such as a skidmorewilhelm calibrator with a special flat insert in place of normal bolt head holding insert .
the special insert is required to allow access to measure the dti gaps .
num .
tapered leaf thickness feeler gauge num inch .
use the same gauge as to be used to inspect the bolts after installation .
num .
steel section to mount bolt calibrator such as a flange of girder or cross frame that is accessible from the ground .
num .
impact and manual wrenches to tighten bolts .
equipment should be the same as to be used in the work .
c. procedure .
perform the following steps num .
install bolt nut dti and standard washer into bolt tension measuring device .
ensure that the assembly matches that to be used in the work unless bolts are too short to fit in the device .
if the bolts are too short use longer bolts of the same diameter and from the same manufacturer to perform the dti verification .
test num assemblies for each rotationalcapacity lot .
num .
tighten the nut to the tension listed in table snum .
use another wrench on the bolt head to prevent rotation of the head against the dti if the dti is under the bolt head .
if an impact wrench is used tighten to a load slightly below the required load and use a manual wrench to attain the required tension .
num table snum bolt tension for a num bolts bolt size num num num num num num num bolt tension kipsnum num num num num num num num num .
bolt tension equals num minimum installation tension num .
determine and record the number of spaces between the protrusions on the dti that the num inch thickness gauge is refused .
the total number of spaces and the maximum verification refusals are listed in table snum .
if the number of spaces that the gauge is refused exceeds the maximum verification refusals listed in table snum the dti fails the verification test .
table snum dti maximum verification refusals bolt size num num num num num num num number of spaces on dtis num num num num num num num maximum verification refusalsnum num num num num num num num num .
if the dti is coated and under the nut the maximum verification refusals is the number of spaces on the washer minus num .
num .
further tighten the bolt until the numinch thickness gage is refused at all spaces but a visible gap exists in at least one space .
record the load as read on the tension measuring device .
num .
remove the bolt from the calibrator and turn the nut on the threads of the bolt by hand .
if the nut is able to be turned on the complete length of the threads the dti is acceptable .
if the nut is unable to go the full length but the load at the minimum dti gap measured in step num is less than num percent of the average tension recorded during the rotationalcapacity test the dti is acceptable .
if the nut can not be run the full thread length and the tension at the smallest gap condition is greater than num percent of the average tension recorded during the rotationalcapacity test the dti is not acceptable .
num .
if any of the num dtis for the lot are found to be not acceptable reject the dti lot .
d. report .
report the following num .
size manufacturer and lot number for the bolt assembly used in the testing .
num .
size manufacturer and lot number for the dti .
num .
results of testing .
